items.title: NT cattle stations assess flood damage, as rain in central Australia declared natural disaster
items.summary: Disaster recovery funding is activated by the NT and federal governments, as flood-affected communities begin counting the cost.

items.title: Winegrape growers welcome the establishment of national vineyard register
items.summary: Grape growers have endured a tough few years and there are hopes that a national database will help to improve the industry's fortunes.

items.title: Dingo advocates call for end to culls and recognition of environmental and cultural value
items.summary: A campaign to introduce protections to native dingoes has taken its fight to parliament house, arguing that treating dingoes as pests is causing deep cultural and environmental harm.

items.title: Switzerland's Crumbling Giants
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Albanese's week unravelled by one-word description of Grace Tame
items.summary: The prime minister was this week evacuated from the Lodge over a bomb threat and later got stuck in a tit-for-tat with a former Australian of the Year.

items.title: Cuba claims 'armed terrorist infiltration' prevented during open water speedboat shootout
items.summary: Cuban coastguard troops shot dead four people and injured six others they claimed were approaching the country on a speedboat filled with weapons set to be used in an act of terror.

items.title: Abattoir Beaufort River Meats halts operations as $20m in live export transition grants are rolled out
items.summary: Forty farming families and five processors have secured live sheep transition funding from more than 260 applicants, including Beaufort River Meats in the Great Southern, which has temporarily shut down amid ongoing livestock shortages.

items.title: Basil Zempilas apologises to Swan Hills MP Michelle Maynard after incident in WA Parliament
items.summary: WA Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas apologises to a Labor backbencher who says she felt "intimidated" by him when he stood over her in parliament on Wednesday afternoon.

items.title: High levels of E. coli and dead fish found in River Torrens, causing a stink
items.summary: Rowers have had to move their training and a boat operator has held off bookings after high levels of E. coli were detected alongside dead fish on a stretch of the River Torrens in Adelaide.

items.title: How an onstage clash between a future NT administrator and a political hopeful drew battle lines
items.summary: A keynote speaker shoved an environmental activist at a conference in 2023. Now, one of them is the Northern Territory's next administrator.

items.title: Coral colony discovered by mother and daughter citizen scientists could be world's largest
items.summary: Mother and daughter citizen scientists find what is believed to be the largest coral colony on the Great Barrier Reef and possibly in the world.

items.title: Mother and daughter discover largest known coral on Great Barrier Reef
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: What is mammalian meat allergy and how do you develop it?
items.summary: Jeremy Webb's death in 2022 from a tick-induced red meat allergy is the first to be recorded in Australia. Here's what we know about mammalian meat allergy and how to avoid it.

items.title: Christopher Turner jailed over fatal gas mix-up at Bankstown-Lidcombe Hospital
items.summary: Newborn John Ghanem died, while baby Amelia Khan suffered severe and permanent brain damage when they were inadvertently given nitrous oxide instead of oxygen after their births.

items.title: Qantas shares fall more than 6 per cent after first-half profit announced
items.summary: Qantas' first-half profit result has disappointed shareholders, but chief executive Vanessa Hudson says the airline's largest fleet renewal in history will pay off.

items.title: Debate about children of 'ISIS brides' has become hyper-politicised
items.summary: The fate of the "ISIS brides" is inextricably linked to constitutional facts but the debate about their future is not taking place in a legal chamber — it is being fought in the court of public opinion.

items.title: Senator Sarah Hanson-Young calls for Triple Zero overhaul at Optus outage hearing
items.summary: A Senate committee hears bombshell testimony about Optus's processes during an outage that led to the deaths of multiple customers who were unable to call Triple Zero.

items.title: Sunset Strip residents learn water unsafe even for washing in after 66 years using it to brush teeth
items.summary: Residents in Sunset Strip knew their water was not safe to drink, but it came as a great shock to read a letter stating it was not safe to bathe in or wash with either.

items.title: Gas giant Arrow Energy takes Australia's biggest pork producer to court over gas pipelines
items.summary: A major energy company is taking Australia's largest pork producer to court over plans to build gas pipelines through its property on Queensland's Western Downs.

items.title: INXS nominated for induction into Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
items.summary: INXS will be considered for induction into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame and is one of 10 first-time nominees on the ballot.

items.title: Former Australian of the Year Grace Tame responds to Anthony Albanese's 'difficult life' apology
items.summary: Grace Tame criticises Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's qualified apology after he described her as "difficult", saying "what a patronising cop-out".

items.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock calls for patience as rate decisions get harder
items.summary: Michelle Bullock gives more details on how quickly developments affecting monetary policy have moved since the middle of last year.

items.title: US tariffs on Australia remain at 10 per cent — for now
items.summary: Trade Minister Don Farrell hopes Australia can dodge a higher tariff rate being imposed by the US, saying trade officials overnight confirmed the tariff rate on Australia would remain at 10 per cent — at least for now.

items.title: Cuba says boat from Florida opened fire at its soldiers, starting fight that killed 4
items.summary: Cuban forces killed four people and wounded six others aboard a Florida-based speedboat that entered Cuban waters and opened fire on a Cuban patrol, the country's government says.

items.title: Mardi Gras is almost here. How well do you know Australian LGBTQIA+ history?
items.summary: Australia's LGBTQIA+ history is full to the brim with groundbreaking art, brave protests and lots of fun along the way. Test how much you know about the queer trailblazers of our country in this quiz.

items.title: Dolphin injured in suspected boat strike
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: What is Shen Yun, the group named in a threat against Prime Minister Anthony Albanese?
items.summary: Police are investigating a bomb threat against a Gold Coast theatre hosting a classical Chinese dance group after a threat was also made against the prime minister's official residence.

items.title: Australians fear falling victim to AI-related crimes, deepfakes and hacks, research shows
items.summary: More than half of Australian adults are worried about AI being used to cause them harm, and almost as many fear falling victim to a crime enabled by the technology, a report found.

items.title: Gary Foley Collection tells activism history through Aboriginal lens
items.summary: The ABC gets a rare look at the Aboriginal History Archive, a little-known collection of thousands of items collected by the well-known activist Gary Foley.

items.title: Prosecutor's breach of WA evidence rules triggers retrial for man accused of child sex offences
items.summary: A man found guilty of sexually abusing his stepdaughters wins a retrial because a "serious breach" by a prosecutor resulted in a "miscarriage of justice".

items.title: Guide to Listening: ABC Classic's Festival of Female Composers and International Women's Day on ABC Jazz
items.summary: For 10 years, in the lead-up to International Women's Day, ABC Classic has celebrated classical music by women across centuries. Here's what's in store for 2026.

items.title: Expanded Newcastle Art Gallery finally opens after decades of turmoil
items.summary: It has been two decades in the making, but the troubled Newcastle Art Gallery expansion is finally opening its doors.

items.title: ASX hits another Qantas tumbles on flat profit, Optus accused of 'lack of care' culture — as it happened
items.summary: The ASX nailed its second successive record close, buoyed by tech stocks and miners while Qantas tumbled after a disappointing set of results

items.title: Tasmanian treasurer to consider slashing high-earner public servant retirement payments
items.summary: The Tasmanian government is considering reducing the superannuation given to high-earning public servants as a way of reining in its $7 billion unfunded superannuation liability, the ABC understands.

items.title: Iceland to hold referendum on joining EU a decade after abandoning membership talks
items.summary: In 2013, Reykjavik abandoned EU membership talks after four years of negotiations, but rising living costs and the ongoing war in Ukraine have rekindled the island nation's interest in joining the bloc.

items.title: Why Australia has become an unlikely getaway for South Korea's biggest baseball teams
items.summary: Australia emerges as an unlikely getaway for some of South Korea's biggest baseball stars.

items.title: Bridgette Buckley speaks about her experience trying to find a rental in Brisbane last year.
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Larry Summers to resign from Harvard over Jeffrey Epstein ties
items.summary: The former US Treasury secretary says it was a "difficult decision" and he will leave at the end of the academic year.

items.title: Adelaide theatre company Slingsby says funding loss forces final curtain call
items.summary: Key figures from Adelaide-based family theatre company Slingsby have decided to let the curtain drop for the final time after missing out on federal government funding.

items.title: SA, Victoria and parts of NSW forecast to receive heaviest rain in over a decade
items.summary: The tropical low currently flooding outback Australia is tipped to track south this weekend, reaching south-east states early next week.

items.title: WARNING: DISTRESSING FOOTAGE A young man is bashed in an IS-inspired homophobic attack
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Suspected serial offender linked to Islamic State walks free over filmed gay bashing
items.summary: A suspected serial violent homophobe linked to an Islamic State terrorist network has walked free on probation after pleading guilty to a brutal snuff-video-style gay bashing.

items.title: WARNING: DISTRESSING FOOTAGE Young man kicked unconscious in IS-inspired homophobic attack
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Labor's capital gains hints are getting less subtle, but will the compromises be worth it?
items.summary: The hints are getting less subtle and Labor's plans on capital gains tax are becoming clearer, but a proposal laden with compromises risks undermining any intergenerational argument.

items.title: More Australians switching to 'riskier' super funds, as industry calls for tighter regulation
items.summary: More young Australians with less super are moving away from tightly regulated super funds to platform-based or self-managed super funds.

items.title: Sydney's iconic Mardi Gras parade route honoured with spot on National Heritage List
items.summary: Nearly half a century on from the first Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade, which ended in violence, the route through the CBD has been recognised as part of Australia's heritage.

items.title: Mamma Mia! star Amanda Seyfried tackles her wildest musical yet
items.summary: The Oscar-nominated star adored working with director Mona Fastvold to resurrect an astonishing religious figure in The Testament of Ann Lee.

items.title: Call to find paintings by Tasmanian colonial-era artist William Charles Piguenit
items.summary: Experts believe "countless" artworks by a famed colonial artist could be sitting in Tasmanian homes, with the owners unaware of their true value.

items.title: Bomb threat against Albanese underscores how complex security has become
items.summary: It's tempting to treat the evacuation of the prime minister from the Lodge this week as a bizarre outlier but that would miss the point.

items.title: Japan to deploy missile systems on island near Taiwan by 2031, defence minister says
items.summary: Japan's government plans to deploy surface-to-air missiles on one of its remote western islands near Taiwan by March 2031, the country's defence minister says.

items.title: First home buyer affordability slips further, new real estate report shows
items.summary: The Australian dream of home ownership is becoming an increasingly unrealistic goal for young Australians, new research from Domain has found, with repayments on an entry-level house now averaging almost half a couple's combined income.

items.title: Man dies, woman in hospital following unit fire at St Marys, Western Sydney
items.summary: A man dies and a woman is taken to hospital in a serious but stable condition after a unit fire at St Marys in Sydney's west.

items.title: Khaled Sabsabi to exhibit two new works at Venice Biennale after controversial dumping and reinstatement
items.summary: Last year, Khaled Sabsabi was dumped from the Venice Biennale to avoid "divisive debate". Now, he announces his work will feature in both the main exhibition and the Australia Pavilion.

items.title: Australians urged to consider leaving Israel and Lebanon, as diplomats' families offered evacuation from Middle East
items.summary: The Australian government is urging Australians to consider leaving Israel and Lebanon, as the prospect of US strikes on Iran puts the region on high alert.

items.title: Algal bloom report blames 'convergence' of factors, but ecologist questions flood finding
items.summary: The SA environment minister says preliminary results of an investigation into the causes of the harmful algal bloom back up what scientists had long suspected, but an ecologist who has criticised the government's response says more detail needs to be released.

items.title: Commonwealth Bank prepares for the AI revolution
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: LGBTQI teens targeted in IS-inspired attacks
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Evelyn Araluen wins $100,000 Victorian Prize for Literature for poetry collection, The Rot
items.summary: Eveyln Araluen has taken out the top award at the Victorian Premier's Literary Awards for The Rot, the follow up to her award-winning debut, Dropbear.

items.title: Edith Cowan University's $853 million Perth CBD campus evacuated three days into first semester
items.summary: The brand new Edith Cowan University precinct in Perth's CBD is evacuated, with hundreds of students pouring into city streets just three days into the first semester.
